duties_responsibilities.duty: Support the acquisition of one of the country’s most advanced new weapons platforms, and assist with the transition from EMD to Production phase.
Assist in implementing and executing transition from EMD to Production phase and support manufacturing readiness assessments per the DoD Manufacturing Readiness Level Guide.
Mature and transition lab manufacturing technology developments to a manufacturing assembly line.
Evaluate bonded composite manufacturing techniques, testing, and inspections.

Manage the quality review and standup of manufacturing capability in the Engineering, Manufacturing and Development (EMD) phase, as well as the Production phase, on an ACAT I or equivalent development program.
Develop and coordinate DoD 5000.02 acquisition milestone plans and associated reporting documentation for one or more ACAT I and/or ACAT II (or equivalent) acquisition programs.
Prepare documentation, presentation materials, and staff packages to support acquisition milestone coordination and decisions.
Obtain and maintain a federal security clearance, including an ACTIVE and CURRENT SECRET clearance and the ability to obtain a TS/SCI federal security clearance.
